revised_title: Neutron Scattering in Biology, Chemistry, and Physics: Applications and Techniques
tldr: This article discusses the use of neutron scattering in studying magnetization densities and electronic states in crystals. The technique provides a sensitive method for understanding the behavior of valence electrons in materials, offering insights into the magnetic properties of solids. The author explores the applications of this method in various fields, including biology, chemistry, and physics, and highlights recent advancements in the technique.
